title: Electrical installations—Selection of cables Part 1.1: Cables for alternating voltages up to and including 0.6/1 kV—Typical Australian installation conditions

scope.voltage_range: up to and including 0.6/1 kV at 50 Hz a.c.
scope.objective: Specify current-carrying capacity, voltage drop and short-circuit temperature rise of cables

technical_committee.title: Wiring Rules
technical_committee.type: Joint Standards Australia / Standards New Zealand Committee
organizations: Communications, Electrical and Plumbing Union—Electrical Division
Electrical Contractors Association of New Zealand
ElectroComms and Energy Utilities Industries Skills Council
Ministry of Business, Innovation and Employment, New Zealand
New Zealand Manufacturers and Exporters Association

key_changes_2017.economic_optimization: New cable selection recommendations with example in Appendix A
key_changes_2017.magnetic_fields: Circuit recommendations for low magnetic fields added to Appendix D

dc_cable_selection.requirement: Solar array DC cabling must comply with current-carrying capacity
dc_cable_selection.tables: Use tables 3(1)-3(4) for core cross-section selection
dc_cable_selection.derating: Apply Table 23 derating factors for installation conditions

ac_distribution.voltage_drop: Calculate using provided voltage drop tables
ac_distribution.current_capacity: Select based on inverter output current and installation method

battery_installations.cross_reference: AS/NZS 5139 references this standard for battery cable sizing
battery_installations.safety: Critical for DC battery interconnection cables

grid_connection.requirement: DNSP compliance requires proper cable selection per AS/NZS 3008.1.1
grid_connection.verification: Installation must be verified against this standard

calculation_methods.current_carrying_capacity: Specified tables based on installation method and ambient conditions
calculation_methods.voltage_drop: Tables and calculation methods for acceptable voltage drop limits
calculation_methods.short_circuit: Temperature rise calculations for short-circuit protection
calculation_methods.economic_optimization: NEW 2017: Cost-benefit analysis for cable selection

installation_conditions.installation_methods: Overhead, underground, in conduit, on cable tray, etc.

compliance_integration.as_nzs_3000: Must be used in conjunction with Wiring Rules
compliance_integration.iec_60287: International reference for cable rating calculations

legal_status.licensing: Licensed to TAFE Queensland by Techstreet LLC
legal_status.reproduction: No further reproduction or distribution permitted without written permission
legal_status.standards_currency: Must ensure using current version with any amendments
